segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 4
10. Asuravagga
96. Rāgavinayasutta
“Cattārome, bhikkhave, puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmiṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, these four people are found in the world.

segments.pli: Katame cattāro?
Attahitāya paṭipanno no parahitāya, parahitāya paṭipanno no attahitāya, nevattahitāya paṭipanno no parahitāya, attahitāya ceva paṭipanno parahitāya ca.
segments.en:
1. One who practices to benefit themselves, but not others;
  2. one who practices to benefit others, but not themselves;
  3. one who practices to benefit neither themselves nor others; and
  4. one who practices to benefit both themselves and others.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya paṭipanno hoti no parahitāya?
segments.en: And how does a person practice to benefit themselves, but not others?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā rāgavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, no paraṃ rāgavinayāya samādapeti;
segments.en: It’s when a person practices to remove their own greed, hate, and delusion, but doesn’t encourage others to do the same.

segments.pli: attanā dosavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, no paraṃ dosavinayāya samādapeti;
attanā mohavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, no paraṃ mohavinayāya samādapeti.
Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya.
segments.en: That’s how a person practices to benefit themselves, but not others.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo parahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no attahitāya?
segments.en: And how does a person practice to benefit others, but not themselves?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā na rāgavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, paraṃ rāgavinayāya samādapeti;
segments.en: It’s when a person doesn’t practice to remove their own greed, hate, and delusion, but encourages others to remove theirs.

segments.pli: attanā na dosavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, paraṃ dosavinayāya samādapeti;
attanā na mohavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, paraṃ mohavinayāya samādapeti.
Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo parahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no attahitāya.
segments.en: That’s how a person practices to benefit others, but not themselves.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo nevattahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya?
segments.en: And how does a person practice to benefit neither themselves nor others?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā na rāgavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, no paraṃ rāgavinayāya samādapeti;
segments.en: It’s when a person doesn’t practice to remove their own greed, hate, and delusion, nor do they encourage others to remove theirs.

segments.pli: attanā na dosavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, no paraṃ dosavinayāya samādapeti;
attanā na mohavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, no paraṃ mohavinayāya samādapeti.
Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo nevattahitāya paṭipanno hoti, no parahitāya.
segments.en: That’s how a person practices to benefit neither themselves nor others.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya ceva paṭipanno hoti parahitāya ca?
segments.en: And how does a person practice to benefit both themselves and others?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco puggalo attanā ca rāgavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, parañca rāgavinayāya samādapeti;
segments.en: It’s when a person practices to remove their own greed, hate, and delusion, and encourages others to remove theirs.

segments.pli: attanā ca dosavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, parañca dosavinayāya samādapeti;
attanā ca mohavinayāya paṭipanno hoti, parañca mohavinayāya samādapeti.
Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo attahitāya ceva paṭipanno hoti parahitāya ca.
segments.en: That’s how a person practices to benefit both themselves and others.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro puggalā santo saṃvijjamānā lokasmin”ti.
segments.en: These are the four people found in the world.”

segments.pli: Chaṭṭhaṃ.
